I think that you maybe miss buried point about to catch the exception when the `io.lettuce.core.protocol. AsyncCommand#onComplete(BiConsumer<? super T,Throwable> action)` method invoked.
@ascrutae `buried point` should be called `intercept point`. Please keep the concept consistently.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/21047345/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/21047345)

Coverage increased (+0.004%) to 14.238% when pulling **b6b3469cc5b02f9524834d5de619babcb9d9a3ec on instance-extend** into **98ad680c1e586c31d30f351f8e7a618f795a8d2f on master**.

> I think that you maybe miss buried point about to catch the exception when the `io.lettuce.core.protocol. AsyncCommand#onComplete(BiConsumer<? super T,Throwable> action)` method invoked.

I don not konw why intercept AsyncCommand#onComplete method, please help me~~
I think the question looks like around, could you catch the exception if exception occurs in redis access.

Here are the reasons: 
* The javadoc of  `onComplete(BiConsumer<? super T,Throwable> action)` show that  it will send the command result or the failure resulting from command completion. so I think you'd better to catch the exception.

* The `onComplete` method is a callback method. and it maybe running in another thread. So if  someone write logic in this callback method, it maybe broke the trace.
but the link is normal in the 5.0.0-GA version,
Because I just used a simple skywalking demo, so I  used a simple feign call.
I didn't remember we have any update about feign plugin. It should be same as 5.
I just commented out the feign.hystrix.enabled=true in the configuration file, and the link is fine.why？
Is it still not supported by spring cloud gateway? I used the latest version 6.0 of agant, but it seems that I have not tracked it
Issue tagged as 6.1, @ascutae hasn't worked on that. You could try to contribute the plugin.
Maybe feign has another retry mechanism? I am not familiar with.

The test case added the AsyncCommand#onComplete method, tested the 5.1.3.RELEASE, 5.0.4.RELEASE, 5.0.0.RELEASE version, no trace breaks, please help run testcase at all versions again, thank you for hard work! @ascrutae
I put a comment in your test case, from my understanding, if you didn't do capture/continued, the trace could be broken.

First of all, thank you for your patience, I tried 5.0.0-GA did not have this problem, and the call chain of the spring cloud config configuration center in the 5 version also  will be displayed, but the 6.0 version does not show the service call configuration center, the service is Replaced by the user, Displays the user call configuration center.
Do you upgrade all agents to v6? Because in default mode, v6 agent doesn't accept v5 header, needs manually open.
Try beta. I remember this is fixed in beta release.

when I debug the oap server

I found that:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5259422/51157530-35ad1f80-18bb-11e9-951d-b30dc7f4e7e2.png)

when I enabled the hystrix of A service
the  spanDecorator.getRefsCount() is 0,
when I disabled the hystrix of A service

the  spanDecorator.getRefsCount() will > 0

Can you give me some other debugging suggestions?
Where should I start?

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/21075649/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/21075649)

Coverage increased (+0.002%) to 14.329% when pulling **4f2542911ee758924a8b9d53aaadbe8cef59a963 on heyanlong:master** into **cee0525f747f912c5388e511c8df57c2cd679726 on apache:master**.
Welcome you to bring PHP agent to the community. Thanks.
Also thanks for sharing two user info. Ref #443

The `ref==0` is what I expected when you said the trace is broken. As I said, the context propagation doesn't work right. So, if you could do such debugs.
1. Check the client side plugin, before RPC happens, does context inject right? 
1. Check the server side plugin, do they extract the context from the request header?

Both these I will assume NO. Then you need to find when RPC happens, why context inject didn't work well.

ok
thank you very much
English only.
the skywalking version we use is 5.0GA

Deleting data in ElasticSearch is not very high performance. The suggestions are
1. Set the ElasticSearch with more nodes.
1. Set a very long TTL to make it disable, and write your own scripts/codes to implement TTL at night
1. Similar with (2), contribute the codes to use, which support deleting data at several certain time points each day if you want to contribute to us.
@wu-sheng not yet , if i had good idea，i will give PR

Coverage decreased (-0.002%) to 14.327% when pulling **0342df77dd33f5a877072e31b04851f482edece8 on langyan1022:master** into **4f3e2337122fa081cf6886c78db857b6725002af on apache:master**.
@langyan1022 I changed your code comments and pull request title. I am making the code comments describing the what codes do, rather than what do this pull request.

The root cause of this issue is, the endpoint name in ref, if it is from local span, then it wouldn't be set as id always in java agent. But at the same time, the collector only expects the name are from entry span, which could this segment parse fails and lost.
FYI @peng-yongsheng

> @langyan1022 I changed your code comments and pull request title. I am making the code comments describing the what codes do, rather than what do this pull request.

ok，

My last submission seems to say that coverage is falling, I don’t understand why
Do you set to grpc port? And are you using the backend with same version? It is a very easy error, the codes don't match.

I'm sure I'm using the v6 agent all the time; I tried the 6.0.0-Apache version again today.Project-e calling project-mysql is normal even with hystrix, But the access configuration center display is consistent with the 6.0.0-beta version，this is different from 5.0.0-GA.

We have just fixed a serious bug, https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/pull/2162 , which could lose trace and break topology. But I don't know whether it is related to yours. You could try.

In this kind of issue, we really need to locate the possible point, like @langyan1022 did in https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/issues/2134 . Otherwise, my help will be limited.
Thanks for your guidance, lettuce versions 5.0.0~5.1.3 maven compiler by java8, I will put it in the optional plugin, so I will open [WIP] again.
Sure. Take your time. The codes are going to be frozen at the end of this week for GA. So let's put this feature into 6.1
All right!

Which version of skywalking?
I think you don't follow our documents.

Coverage decreased (-0.0006%) to 14.324% when pulling **b78db50f10782ffc6c455baee34fb8c34b348515 on a198720:len** into **a3e03f61337f9c443a7a9857f3c2bcb7f2e330ce on apache:master**.

> > But I found another problem, if thread A call thread B and thread B call thread C, I can not find the span of B called C.
> 
> This plugin only works if thread c created in thread b. If you are using a thread pool, you have to understand the Context#capture and Context#continued in our plugin APIs. Then make the context propagates across thread b-c

@wu-sheng I got a question.

I use skywalking 6.0.0.beta, mysql as storage, standalone

My code like this:

`@TraceCrossThread
Class GetPartScore implements Callable;

Class GetMidFeature implements Callable{
    public void call(){
            featureServiceMotan.getMidsFeaturesWithRequestId();
    }
}

Thread A:
ExecutorService executorService = Executors.newFixedThreadPool(1);
executorService. submit(new GetPartScore());

Thread B:
ExecutorService executorService = Executors.newFixedThreadPool(1);
    executorService.submit(CallableWrapper.of(new GetMidFeature()));

Thread C:
execute GetMidFeature task

The trace graph is:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3722641/51233800-d972fa00-19a5-11e9-9f19-9e5c334f914d.png)

table segment adds two records
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3722641/51233963-57370580-19a6-11e9-939d-29d821f3747a.png)

table endpoint_inventory adds four records
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3722641/51234583-14762d00-19a8-11e9-8eee-00a2e1196f94.png)



The trace graph is not correct, I think it should be:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3722641/51234073-a846f980-19a6-11e9-977e-160b9fff1f58.png)

I  debug , the problem may be in the preBuild step :

ReferenceIdExchanger class#line 75:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3722641/51234268-3ae79880-19a7-11e9-9ab3-f4c651a6dd5a.png)

In table endpoint_inventory, the GetPartScore endpoint's detect_point is 3, but above code uses DetectPoint.SERVER.ordinal(), that is 0, So the parentEndpointId(=GetPartScore) can't be found, then the last sement parse fail.

If I change the value of the detect_point of the GetPartScore endpoint to 0, then the trace graph is right:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3722641/51234073-a846f980-19a6-11e9-977e-160b9fff1f58.png)


Is this my  code problem?

Thanks for your help
This issue has been located, fixed and will be in GA release. See https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/pull/2162
Query service list is that. Name is service code.

in that machine IT people deloyed four different application, I see UI,sometimes one application miss,and a moment later appearance agen. I tell he use "-javaagent:/path/to/skywalking-agent.jar=agent.application_code=31200,logging.level=debug" method setting agent.bellow is agent.config
```
# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one

# limitations under the License.

# The agent namespace
#agent.namespace=${SW_AGENT_NAMESPACE:ghs-order-diss-log}

# The service name in UI
#agent.service_name=${SW_AGENT_NAME:ghs-order-diss}

# The number of sampled traces per 3 seconds
# Negative number means sample traces as many as possible, most likely 100%
# agent.sample_n_per_3_secs=${SW_AGENT_SAMPLE:-1}

# Authentication active is based on backend setting, see application.yml for more details.
# agent.authentication = ${SW_AGENT_AUTHENTICATION:xxxx}

# The max amount of spans in a single segment.
# Through this config item, skywalking keep your application memory cost estimated.
# agent.span_limit_per_segment=${SW_AGENT_SPAN_LIMIT:300}

# Ignore the segments if their operation names start with these suffix.
# agent.ignore_suffix=${SW_AGENT_IGNORE_SUFFIX:.jpg,.jpeg,.js,.css,.png,.bmp,.gif,.ico,.mp3,.mp4,.html,.svg}

# If true, skywalking agent will save all instrumented classes files in `/debugging` folder.
# Skywalking team may ask for these files in order to resolve compatible problem.
# agent.is_open_debugging_class = ${SW_AGENT_OPEN_DEBUG:true}

# Backend service addresses.
collector.backend_service=${SW_AGENT_COLLECTOR_BACKEND_SERVICES:xx.xx.xx.xx:11800,xx.xx.xx.xx:11800}

# Logging level
logging.level=${SW_LOGGING_LEVEL:DEBUG}

```

from agent log and source code,i find the problem。when org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.plugin.interceptor.enhance.InstMethodsInter execute 105 line,Normal it should call interceptor.afterMethod but it call DubboInterceptor.afterMethod. below is key code
`019-01-17 18:07:33:825 InstMethodsInter :  class[class com.alibaba.dubbo.monitor.support.MonitorFilter] after method[invoke] intercept failure 
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.context.ContextManager.activeSpan(ContextManager.java:156)
	at org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.context.ContextManager.stopSpan(ContextManager.java:160)
	at org.apache.skywalking.apm.plugin.dubbo.DubboInterceptor.afterMethod(DubboInterceptor.java:101)
	at org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.plugin.interceptor.enhance.InstMethodsInter.intercept(InstMethodsInter.java:105)`

You could post the codes in zip at here. Or create a github repo.

For me，the point is collector's performance. I rewrite the load balance rule.
Yes. Load balance is recommended between agent and collector cluster. That is why naming is removed permanently

I already said, npe is not caused the stack, but another plugin. And it wouldn't show. 
You need to read codes and understand tracing stack module, then could understand what I mean.
You need to confirm, how to use your demo to reproduce this npe. We need that to help you. Otherwise, we can't.

two questions:
1: if we plan to use three backend as a cluster by using consul, the agent's collector.backend_service setting is still one of the collector's IP, right?
2: Is it still necessary to use LB between agent and collector when use a collector cluster? why? if it's called cluster, it is strange that no embeded route service to dispatch requests to all collector service evenly.
